intro: Asyneuma michauxioides, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, white, night-blooming flowers that emit a sweet fragrance, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its leaves are alternate, lanceolate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and often branched. Asyneuma michauxioides is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils.
